intro: Linaria meyeri, commonly known as the Persian crucible or yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its striking, elongated yellow flowers that resemble a crucible or a toadflax. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers bloom in clusters along the upper parts of the stems. Linaria meyeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and ease of care.
